entry.title: Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the proposition that addresses should be permitted to continue operations if they demonstrate proof of life and possession through key signatures, despite not participating in a specific update scheme. This concept raises doubts about the practicality and motivation behind implementing such functionality, considering the common practice of discontinuing support for vulnerable software and systems. The message references examples of support lifespans provided by major entities, such as Bitcoin Core with 18 months of support, Ubuntu offering long-term support for up to 5 years, and Windows providing unpaid support for a similar duration. For further details on the lifecycle of various software and systems, a resource is mentioned, accessible at [endoflife.date](https://endoflife.date). This information was shared within the context of the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, highlighting discussions pertinent to updates and support protocols within the realm of Bitcoin development.
